New Records: New Zealand's total of 215/3 is their second highest score at Sky Stadium in Wellington.
Key Match Events: Mitchell Marsh scored an unbeaten 72 runs and took one wicket, earning him the 'Player of the Match' award.
Tim David scored 31* and hit a six and a boundary in the final over to secure the win for Australia.
Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra had a 100+ run partnership for New Zealand.
Mitchell Santner took two wickets for New Zealand.
Lockie Ferguson and Adam Milne took one wicket each for New Zealand.
Mitchell Starc, Pat Cummins, and Mitchell Marsh each took one wicket for Australia.
Pre-Game Insights: Mitchell Santner won the toss and decided to bat first.
Australia recently defeated the West Indies 2-1 in a T20 series.
David Warner is playing his last bilateral T20 series.
New Zealand won their last T20I series against Pakistan 4-1.
The Sky Stadium pitch is expected to favor batsmen, leading to a high-scoring match.
Post-Match Reflections: Mitchell Marsh expressed pride in his team's performance and highlighted the importance of experienced players like Pat Cummins and Mitchell Starc.
David Warner commented on the Kiwi crowd's behavior and his approach to handling it.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the first of a 3-T20 series, the last for both teams before the T20 World Cup.
The match was played at Sky Stadium in Wellington.
Australia's Aaron Hardie was ruled out of the series due to a calf injury and replaced by Spencer Johnson.
